recommended_next_actions: Request audit/chronology export (create/modify/link actions) for relevant crime refs
Obtain CAD/event IDs for dates mentioned (22 Jun 2025; 24 Jul 2024; 2 Nov 2024)
Confirm OIC assignment via .eml with full headers
Preserve/attach original audio WAV + hashes aligned to transcript
legal_mapping: DPA 2018 Part 3 (Law Enforcement) – right of access (s.45)
DPA 2018 Part 3 – accuracy principle (records must be accurate & kept up to date)
Victims’ Code of Practice – right to updates & VPS (policy obligation)

death_by_silence_escalator.duty_name: Victims’ Code – keep informed / call-back after contact request

entries.quote: ﻿Sussex Police Mishandling of Stalking Case – Ben Carter
entries.speaker: Unknown

entries.quote: Complainant:
entries.speaker: Unknown

entries.quote: Ben Carter
entries.speaker: Unknown

entries.quote: Subject of Complaint:
entries.speaker: Unknown

entries.quote: Systemic failure by Sussex Police to safeguard the victim in a high-risk stalking case involving Alanna O’Hare. Misconduct includes failure to notify the victim of case decisions, mishandling of evidence, provision of false or inconsistent crime references, and obstruction of the Victim’s Right to Review process.
entries.speaker: Unknown

entries.quote: Key Allegations:
entries.speaker: Unknown

entries.quote: 1.  No Notification of No Further Action Decision
entries.speaker: Unknown

entries.quote: * On 9 May 2025, my stalker Alanna O’Hare contacted me directly with threats that implied she had been told her bail had ended and there would be no further action.
entries.speaker: Unknown

entries.quote: * I was never informed of this decision by Sussex Police.
entries.speaker: Unknown

entries.quote: * This breach caused immediate escalation in psychological harm, undermining my safety and preventing timely invocation of the Victim’s Right to Review (VRR).
entries.speaker: Unknown

entries.quote: 2.  Contradictory Crime References and Obstruction
entries.speaker: Unknown

entries.quote: * On 4 July 2025, in a recorded 101 call, I had to confirm multiple crime reference numbers myself:
entries.speaker: Unknown

entries.quote: * 47240141246 (Original stalking complaint)
entries.speaker: Unknown
legal_mapping: DPA 2018 Part 3 – accuracy & record integrity

entries.quote: * 47240214305 (New incident – May 2025 threats, reported 16 May)
entries.speaker: Unknown
legal_mapping: DPA 2018 Part 3 – accuracy & record integrity

entries.quote: * I was told both were active and under the same officer (PC Gasson) — despite being given no formal case update or safeguarding follow-up.
entries.speaker: Ben Carter

entries.quote: * The 101 handler acknowledged that these were “two separate crimes”, but also claimed “this is nothing for you to worry about,” dismissing my confusion over conflicting records.
entries.speaker: Unknown

entries.quote: 3. 🧾 False Recordkeeping and SAR Breach
entries.speaker: Unknown

entries.quote: * I submitted a Subject Access Request on 9 April 2025, days before a suicide attempt triggered by ongoing inaction and institutional gaslighting.
entries.speaker: Ben Carter

entries.quote: * Despite confirmation that a new rape threat was logged on 22 June 2025, I was given no updates, violating my rights as a data subject and as a victim of crime.
entries.speaker: Unknown
legal_mapping: Disclosure/audit – chronology should show logging action

entries.quote: 4. 🧑‍⚖️ Obstruction of CPS Oversight and Misuse of Stalking Clinic
entries.speaker: Unknown

entries.quote: * Veritas Justice informed me that the CPS attended a Sussex Police Stalking Clinic on 29 April 2025 where my case was discussed and interest was shown.
entries.speaker: Unknown

entries.quote: * However, I was not contacted either by Sussex Police or the CPS.
entries.speaker: Unknown

entries.quote: * This sequence reveals that Sussex Police notified the perpetrator of an NFA before this safeguarding review even took place — violating policy and undermining external scrutiny.
entries.speaker: Unknown

entries.quote: 5. 📞 45+ Calls Ignored – Pattern of Dismissal
entries.speaker: Unknown

entries.quote: * I have made over 45 calls seeking updates or officer contact. No adequate response has been provided.
entries.speaker: Unknown

entries.quote: * A virtual meeting was offered (22 June), then ignored.
entries.speaker: Unknown

entries.quote: * At no stage was I informed that PC Gasson had taken over — I only found out by chasing this information myself on a recorded line.
entries.speaker: Unknown

entries.quote: Officers Named in Complaint:
entries.speaker: Unknown

entries.quote: * PC Jonathan Dixon – informed suspect of NFA prematurely
entries.speaker: Unknown

needs: Officer note re: suicide disclosure logging & correction

entries.quote: * PC Gasson – currently handling the case but failed to contact me
entries.speaker: Unknown

entries.quote: * PC Russell and PC Clarke – named in earlier case interactions
entries.speaker: Unknown

entries.quote: * 101 Call Handler (04 July 2025) – dismissive and obstructive during a safeguarding query
entries.speaker: Unknown

entries.quote: Outcome Sought:
entries.speaker: Unknown

entries.quote: * Full investigation into the systemic failure to log, notify, and act on stalking-related threats and disclosures.
entries.speaker: Unknown

entries.quote: * Confirmation of when, how, and why the NFA decision was made — and whether CPS actually reviewed the evidence.
entries.speaker: Unknown

entries.quote: * Disciplinary action for officers involved in obstructing safeguarding, including those who misled or failed to engage with CPS protocols.
entries.speaker: Unknown

entries.quote: * Re-opening of the VRR opportunity and acknowledgment that Sussex Police unlawfully denied me access to justice.
entries.speaker: Unknown

entries.quote: [Ben Carter: 18:11.7] I've already had an email from Sussex Police saying that I can have a, I can have a virtual meeting, to log my new complaint. This was on the 22nd?
